Indian youth which comprises about the majority of Indian population can take the initiative of changing country's political scenario by deciding to vote. This simple yet most neglected form of action can drastically affect the Indian government. Negligence, laziness whatever might be the reasons it is disappointing to admit that youngsters usually do not utilize their power to vote. Instead of complaining about the inefficiency of the government isn't it worthwhile to change that government with someone hopefully better? 

                      Apart from voting, youth organizations can be formed to address the local issues of the people. These organizations can collaborate or seek help from the governing party. The governing party might be influenced by these organizations and implement positive changes in the society.

                     Another unique way of changing the political scenario would be the youth entering in to politics. Considering that youngsters need to be motivated to vote first, asking them to join the politics would be a rather high expectation. But it is always not bad to hope for the best things to happen even if they are a bit difficult.

                     These few measures by the youth can contribute largely in changing the political scenario of our country and can make our country a better place to live.
